intro: Diclisodon, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants typically have upright, branched stems and are characterized by their small, white or pale yellow flowers that resemble snowflakes. Diclisodon species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. They are also valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh climates.
